title: Automated Specimen Preparation for Electron Microscopy
content: Biological electron microscopy of specimens prepared with chemical fixation, heavy metals, and resin embedding has been around for over 50 years and continues to revolutionize biomedical and botanical structural biology. This includes research and clinical diagnostic TEM and is especially true with the recent explosive growth of volume EM, which uniquely provides molecular-resolution structural biology in near-millimeter volumes while enabling correlative light and x-ray microscopy [1-4].
